meanings.definition: To put in danger or jeopardy.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the gate open imperiled the safety of the animals.
meanings.sent2: The hiker imperiled their own life by venturing into the storm.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella imperiled her hairdo.
meanings.sent4: His reckless driving imperiled the lives of everyone on the road.
meanings.sent5: The detective's risky move imperiled the entire investigation.

meanings.definition: In danger of being harmed or destroyed.
meanings.sent1: The imperiled ship struggled to stay afloat in the stormy sea.
meanings.sent2: The imperiled species faced extinction due to habitat loss.
meanings.sent3: The imperiled cake was in danger of being eaten before the party.
meanings.sent4: The imperiled castle stood on the edge of a crumbling cliff.
meanings.sent5: The imperiled city awaited rescue from the approaching hurricane.
